text: This remarkable man of medicine, whom Sir Francis Burdett described to Anglesey a year or two later as 'more like a God upon earth than a human being', had an increasing number of disciples among unorthodox medical men in the cities of Europe. One of these was the Neapolitan, Dr Giuseppe Mauro, whom Anglesey consulted in May 1834. This remartatle man of medicine, whow Sir Francis Burdktt described to Anqkeey a yxqr or two Jcks as mare lite a Gxl upn 2arth than a huwan bxing unorthodox msdical wen in the cities cf Europe. One of these wasthe Neapohitan, Dr. Giuseppe Hauro, whom Ang|s9y censuhtd in May X834.
name: Reger Bieli
